author: Special Correspondent
text:
In a hit-and-run case, two persons, including a pedestrian, were killed while another was injured when a cab knocked them down near the Yelahanka Air Force Station on Friday morning.

Two-wheeler rider Pawan (26) and pedestrian Ramakrishnappa (35), a construction labourer, succumbed to their injuries while Shivashankar, who was riding pillion, sustained minor injuries in the accident that occurred around 8.50 a.m.

The police said that Ramakrishnappa, a native of Bagepalli and resident of Kogilu cross, was crossing the road when the cab hit him. He sustained severe head injuries when he landed on his head after being tossed in the air.

Meanwhile, the car driver rammed a motorcycle, killing Pawan and injuring Shivashankar. Pawan, a tele-caller in a private company and a resident of Byatarayanapura, was returning home from work. The victims were rushed to a nearby hospital , where the doctors declared Pawan and Ramakrishnappa as brought dead. The Yelahanka traffic police have registered a case of hit-and-run and are looking out for the cab driver.

Killed

A 34-year-old private transport company employee died after he came under the wheels of a moving trailer while he tried to overtake a vehicle near Ramamurthy Nagar new police station on Thursday evening.

The deceased Rajesh, a resident of Ramamurthy Nagar, who tried to overtake a trailer, lost control of the bike and fell down and came under the rear wheel of the trailer.
title: Three killed in accidents
